definition: can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Isn't this a priceless morning, madam ?
sentences.chinese: 真是个千金难买的早晨，夫人。

sentences.english: The value of a university education is priceless.
sentences.chinese: 大学教育的益处是千金难买的。

sentences.english: Money doesn't buy is friends and more spring often leave.
sentences.chinese: 千金难买是朋友，朋友多了春常留。

sentences.english: Good health is an invaluable blessing.
sentences.chinese: 身体健康是千金难买的福气。

definition: can be discovered but not sought (idiom)/one can only come across such things serendipitously
goose feather sent from afar, a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it (idiom); It's not the gift that counts, but the thought behind it.
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
slight present but weighty meaning (idiom); It's not the present the counts, it's the thought behind it.
rare/uncommon/rarity/to value as a rarity/to cherish/Taiwan pr. [xi1 han3]
lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold, money cannot buy you time. (idiom)/fig. Time is precious and must be treasured.
pinyin: yi1 cun4 guang1 yin1 yi1 cun4 jin1 , cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1
related.word: 一寸光阴一寸金，寸金难买寸光阴

definition: lit. money will make the Devil turn millstones (idiom)/fig. with money, you can do anything you like
pinyin: you3 qian2 neng2 shi3 gui3 tui1 mo4

definition: good medicine tastes bitter (idiom); fig. frank criticism is hard to swallow
as the proverb says/as they say...
